Activity: Arrive at the office, log in to my computer, and check emails for any urgent requests or updates regarding the EHR collection and influenza trend analysis project.
Review project documentation related to data quality and the centralized tracking system. Familiarize myself with the system's functionalities and reporting procedures.
Begin identifying data quality issues by examining sample EHR data extracts. Focus on common issues such as missing values, incorrect data types, and inconsistencies across records.
Log the identified data quality issues into the centralized tracking system. Include a detailed description of the issue, the affected data elements, and the date of detection.
Draft an email to @da-1, @da-2, @ehrv-1 to discuss initial findings regarding data quality issues and solicit their input on potential sources of error.
Lunch break. Grab a sandwich and browse some tech news websites.
Review responses from @da-1, @da-2, @ehrv-1, regarding potential data quality issues. Refine issue descriptions in the tracking system based on their feedback.
Begin root cause analysis for the identified data quality issues. Start with the most prevalent or impactful issues, focusing on potential system errors or data entry inconsistencies.
Brainstorm potential root causes for data quality issues. Consider data mapping errors, data entry errors, and system integration issues.
Document the root cause analysis process and findings for each identified issue. Include the underlying cause(s) and the steps taken to identify them.
Review and update documentation regarding data quality issues. Create a detailed report to share with relevant stakeholders and prepare for tomorrow's tasks.
